record.description: Simplest way to ensure integrity of transmissions across adjacencies when used as outer keys and integrity of TIEs when used as inner keys. Recommended for most interoperable security protection.
Same as HMAC-SHA256 with stronger protection.

Recommended for high security applications where private keys are protected by according nodes. Recommended as well in case not only integrity but origin validation is necessary for TIEs. Recommended when adjacencies must be protected without disclosing the secrets on both sides of the adjacency.
Same as SHA256-RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 with stronger protection.

record.name: ipv4address
record.comment: Content is IPv4

record.name: ipv6address
record.comment: Content is IPv6

record.name: transactionid
record.comment: Transaction ID set by client in, e.g., in 6LoWPAN.

record.name: top
record.comment: Higher order bits

record.name: bottom
record.comment: Lower order bits

record.name: name
record.comment: Node or adjacency name.

record.name: local_id
record.comment: Local link ID.

record.name: flood_port
record.comment: UDP port to which we can receive flooded TIEs.

record.name: link_mtu_size
record.comment: Layer 2 MTU, used to discover mismatch.

record.name: link_bandwidth
record.comment: Local link bandwidth on the interface.

record.name: neighbor
record.comment: Reflects the neighbor once received to provide 3-way connectivity.

record.name: pod
record.comment: Node's PoD.

record.name: node_capabilities
record.comment: Node capabilities supported.

record.name: link_capabilities
record.comment: Capabilities of this link.

record.name: holdtime
record.comment: Required holdtime of the adjacency, i.e., for how long a period should adjacency be kept up without valid LIE reception.

record.name: label
record.comment: Optional, unsolicited, downstream assigned locally significant label value for the adjacency.

record.name: not_a_ztp_offer
record.comment: Indicates that the level on the LIE must not be used to derive a ZTP level by the receiving node.

record.name: you_are_flood_repeater
record.comment: Indicates to the northbound neighbor that it should be reflooding TIEs received from this node to achieve flood reduction and balancing for northbound flooding.

record.name: you_are_sending_too_quickly
record.comment: Indicates to the neighbor to flood node TIEs only and slow down all other TIEs. Ignored when received from southbound neighbor.

record.name: instance_name
record.comment: Instance name in case multiple RIFT instances running on the same interface.

record.name: fabric_id
record.comment: It provides the optional ID of the fabric configured. This must match the information advertised on the node element.

record.name: bfd
record.comment: Indicates that the link is supporting BFD.

record.name: ipv4_forwarding_capable
record.comment: Indicates whether the interface will support IPv4 forwarding.

record.name: local_id
record.comment: Node-wide unique value for the local link.

record.name: remote_id
record.comment: Received remote link ID for this link.

record.name: platform_interface_index
record.comment: Describes the local interface index of the link.

record.name: platform_interface_name
record.comment: Describes the local interface name.

record.name: trusted_outer_security_key
record.comment: Indicates whether the link is secured, i.e., protected by outer key, absence of this element means no indication, undefined outer key means not secured.

record.name: bfd_up
record.comment: Indicates whether the link is protected by established BFD session.

record.name: address_families
record.comment: Optional indication that address families are up on the interface.

record.name: originator
record.comment: System ID of the originator.

record.name: remote_id
record.comment: ID of remote side of the link.

record.name: protocol_minor_version
record.comment: Must advertise supported minor version dialect that way.

record.name: flood_reduction
record.comment: Indicates that node supports flood reduction.

record.name: hierarchy_indications
record.comment: Indicates place in hierarchy, i.e., top of fabric or leaf only (in ZTP) or support for L2L procedures.

record.name: overload
record.comment: Indicates that node is in overload; do not transit traffic through it.

record.name: level
record.comment: Level of neighbor.

record.name: cost
record.comment: Cost to neighbor. Ignore anything equal or larger than 'infinite_distance' and equal to 'invalid_distance'.

record.name: link_ids
record.comment: Carries description of multiple parallel links in a TIE.

record.name: bandwidth
record.comment: Total bandwidth to neighbor as sum of all parallel links.

record.name: level
record.comment: Level of the node.

record.name: neighbors
record.comment: Node's neighbors. Multiple node TIEs can carry disjoint sets of neighbors.

record.name: capabilities
record.comment: Capabilities of the node.

record.name: flags
record.comment: Flags of the node.

record.name: name
record.comment: Optional node name for easier operations.

record.name: pod
record.comment: Pod to which the node belongs.

record.name: startup_time
record.comment: Optional startup time of the node.

record.name: miscabled_links
record.comment: If any local links are miscabled, this indication is flooded.

record.name: same_plane_tofs
record.comment: ToFs in the same plane. only carried by ToF. Multiple node TIEs can carry disjoint sets of ToFs that must be joined to form a single set.

record.name: fabric_id
record.comment: It provides the optional ID of the fabric configured

record.name: major_version
record.comment: Major version of protocol.

record.name: minor_version
record.comment: Minor version of protocol.

record.name: sender
record.comment: Node sending the packet; in case of LIE/TIRE/TIDE also the originator of it.

record.name: level
record.comment: Level of the node sending the packet, required on everything except LIEs. Lack of presence on LIEs indicates undefined_level and is used in ZTP procedures.

record.name: metric
record.comment: Distance of the prefix.

record.name: tags
record.comment: Generic unordered set of route tags, can be redistributed to other protocols or used within the context of real time analytics.

record.name: monotonic_clock
record.comment: Monotonic clock for mobile addresses.

record.name: loopback
record.comment: Indicates if the prefix is a node loopback.

record.name: directly_attached
record.comment: Indicates that the prefix is directly attached.

record.name: from_link
record.comment: Link to which the address belongs to.

record.name: label
record.comment: Optional, per-prefix significant label.

record.name: prefixes
record.comment: Prefixes with the associated attributes.

record.name: start_range
record.comment: First TIE header in the TIDE packet.

record.name: end_range
record.comment: Last TIE header in the TIDE packet.

record.name: headers
record.comment: _sorted_ list of headers.

record.name: node
record.comment: Used in case of enum common.tietypetype.nodetietype.

record.name: prefixes
record.comment: Used in case of enum common.tietypetype.prefixtietype.

record.name: positive_disaggregation_prefixes
record.comment: Positive prefixes (always southbound).

record.name: negative_disaggregation_prefixes
record.comment: Transitive, negative prefixes (always southbound)

record.name: external_prefixes
record.comment: Externally reimported prefixes.

record.name: positive_external_disaggregation_prefixes
record.comment: Positive external disaggregated prefixes (always southbound).

record.name: keyvalues
record.comment: Key-value store elements.

record.name: tieid
record.comment: ID of TIE.

record.name: seq_nr
record.comment: Sequence number of TIE.

record.name: origination_time
record.comment: Absolute timestamp when TIE was generated.

record.name: origination_lifetime
record.comment: Original lifetime when TIE was generated.

record.name: remaining_lifetime
record.comment: Remaining lifetime.

record.name: direction
record.comment: Direction of TIE.

record.name: originator
record.comment: Indicates originator of TIE.

record.name: tietype
record.comment: Type of TIE.

record.name: tie_nr
record.comment: Number of TIE.
